intro: Heterotropa pseudosavatieri, commonly known as the false savatieri's bladder, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers with five petals, typically arranged in dense clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
